revised_title: Simple Exchange Waves in Fixed Beds: Adiabatic Absorption and Desorption
tldr: The authors apply simple wave theory to study adiabatic adsorption and desorption in fixed beds, considering the heat and temperature dependence of the adsorption isotherm. They find that during saturation, a shock is formed, and the heat released by adsorption moves ahead as a kinematic temperature wave. This work provides a complete description of the non-isothermal behavior of a single adsorbate in fixed bed processes.
